topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Restoring the Cloud

body.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade includes a backup and restore application called Attis which you can use to backup and restore essential system files and databases on the running cloud. Attis is automatically installed on each of the controller nodes in the non-KVM region. Attis uses a command line interface. For more information, see Attis Backup and Restore CLI.

section.title: When to restore
section.p:
You should restore the HLM VM or other appliances if there are any issues with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade components, for example:
there is database corruption
when two controllers have failed. HA Services are not guaranteed to be resilient after a second failure.

section.title: Restoring the lifecycle manager
section.p: You can use Attis to restore an HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade lifecycle manager.
To restore the lifecycle manager from a previous backup.:

ol.li: Log in to lifecycle manager host as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i
Execute the following commands to change to the Attis user:sudo -i su attis

Authenticate using export variables:export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_PASSWORD=1234 export OS_AUTH_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0Optionally you can pass the authentication values when you execute a CLI command, for example:--os-tenant-name "admin" --os-username "admin" --os-password "1234" --os-auth-url "http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0"
Execute the following command to start the restore:attis restore --config-id <Config_ID_of_ HLM_Appliance_Data_Restore> --backup-id BACKUP_IDWhere:

ul.li: CONFIG_ID authenticates using the ID configuration file.
BACKUP_ID is the ID of the backup from which you want to perform the restore. Use the attis backuplog command to get the back up ID for the job.

section.title: Restoring the Cloud Controller Database
section.p: You can use Attis to restore the three node MySQL cluster (Percona XtraDB Cluster) that runs in cloud controller nodes.

ol.li: Log into the cloud controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i

Update required parameters of the configuration template you are using before you trigger restore. Enter values into each of the blank fields in the file:
for NFS storage edit /etc/attis/config_template/cloudcontrollerappliancedbrestore_NFS.json file
for SCP storage edit the /etc/attis/config_template/cloudcontrollerappliancedbrestore_scp.json file.
You can use the attis backuplog command to locate the backup_base_dirpath and restore_to_incrementnumber values in the base_folder and last_incremental_ref column from output of command. The following is an example of /etc/attis/config_template/cloudcontrollerappliancedbrestore_scp.json:
Update the Storage parameters (SCP or NFS).

section.p: To restore the cloud controller database from a previous backup.:

ol.li: Log into the cloud controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i
Change to the Attis user: sudo su attis

Perform one of the following:
for NFS storageattis restore --config-path /etc/attis/config_template/cloudcontrollerappliancedbrestore_NFS.jsonfor SCP storage attis restore --config-path /etc/attis/config_template/cloudcontrollerappliancedbrestore_scp.json
After restore job is complete, ssh to the compute proxy nodes from HLM, and restart nova-compute service:service nova-compute restart

section.title: Restoring the VSD database
section.p: You can use Attis to restore the HP DCN VSD database from a previous backup..

ol.li: Log in the VSD controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i
SSH to the VSD node from controller and stop all services on VSD. service vsd stop
Execute the following command: attis restore --config-id <Config_ID_of_VSD_Appliance_DB_Restore> --backup-id BACKUP_ID
After restore job is complete, SSH to the VSD node and restart the VSD service. service vsd restart

section.title: Restoring the VSC system files
section.p:
You can use Attis to restore the HP DCN VSC system files from a previous backup..
Log into the VSC controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i
Execute the following command:attis restore --config-id <Config_ID_of_VSC_Appliance_config_files_Restore> --backup-id BACKUP_ID

section.title: Restoring the KVM region system files
section.p: You can use Attis to restore the KVM region system files from a previous backup..

ol.li: Log into the active KVM region controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the root user:sudo -i
Execute the following command to perform the back up.attis restore --config-id <Config_ID_of_WR_Appliance_system_files_Restore> --backup-id BACKUP_ID

section.title: Restoring the Baremetal Controller database and files
section.p: You can use Attis to restore the baremetal controllers in a Sacaramento deployment from a previous backup.

ol.li: Log into the active baremetal controller as the cghelion user.
Change to the Attis user:sudo su attis
Execute the following command:attis restore --config-id <Config_ID_of_BM_Controller_Data_Restore> --backup-id BACKUP_ID
